{"blocks":[{"key":"edamv","text":"Abstract","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ndqd","text":"As part of the GP2 initiative we will generate long-read sequencing data for ~1000 samples to better understand the genetic architecture of Parkinson's disease. To generate this large-scale Nanopore data we have developed a protocol for processing and long-read sequencing frozen human blood samples, targeting an N50 of ~30kb and ~30X coverage. ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9cqi5","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bdqab","text":"

†Correspondence to: Kimberley Billingsley billingsleykj@nih.gov

","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cokpl","text":"Cell pellets should be frozen dry with as much liquid removed as possible.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ok0h","text":"For non-diploid or non-human cells, the cell input should be scaled appropriately to contain 5–25 µg of DNA.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6geaj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"1CB62ECA272611EE9FC90A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.pacb.com/wp-content/uploads/Procedure-checklist-Extracting-HMW-DNA-using-the-Nanobind-HT-CBB-kit-for-mammalian-cultured-cells-on-KingFisher-Apex-system.pdf"}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ae89","text":"Thaw frozen cell pellets on ice (about 5 to 10 minutes).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9gvs3","text":"After ~ , when the program pauses do not press 'Next'. Add   isopropanol (IPA) to lysis binding plate. {"blocks":[{"key":"372nv","text":"When the program ends after ~  (from the start), transfer eluate from Plate 1 (Eluate Plate) to a 1.5mL Eppendorf DNA LoBind tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":70,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":29,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6si5i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2j7tu","text":"Note: The program is designed to leave the nanobind disk in the elution plate. If the nanobind disk ends up in the tip comb plate, this does not affect extraction performance. Use a P200 to remove any elution buffer remaining on nanobind disk. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3900,"guid":"07A89192274211EE86FC0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c3f3a","text":"Pipette mix the sample 10 times with a standard P200 pipette to homogenize and disrupt any unsolubilized \"jellies\" that may be present.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ei0e3","text":"Take care to disrupt any regions that feel more viscous than other regions.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ekm1n","text":"Limited pipette mixing will not noticeably reduce DNA size or sequencing read lengths but is important for accurate quantification and consistent sequencing performance. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"181g1","text":"Let samples rest overnight at Room Temperature (RT).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"142ps","text":"Following overnight rest, pipette mix 10X with a standard P200 pipette and analyze the recovery and purity as described in QC Procedure (Step 2).  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1dmtb","text":"Hand-shear each sample ~ 20X with   Luer-Lock syringes and 1.5” needles (bringing sample up into needle and depressing plunger counts as 1 cycle).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":34,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2851n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8knjc","text":"Note: This step isn't to shear the DNA to a specific size, it is required to get an accurate QC reading for downstream processes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"AC89D9A0A91711ECB4CCB76FD73A44A4","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bv98u","text":"Quantify by taking triplicate measurements (top, middle, bottom) on the Qubit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8iqgi","text":"If coefficient of variation (CV) is \u003c10% for the three measurements, move on to the size selection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dlsat","text":"If the CV is greater than 10%, further hand shearing is needed. Shear another 10x and take triplicate measurements on the Qubit. Repeat this until the CV is less than 10%. Once achieved, measure on the Nanodrop.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6hsq","text":"If the CV is less than 10% for the three Qubit measurements, measure on the Nanodrop and size on the Agilent Tapestation 4200 or femto pulse. {"blocks":[{"key":"e1b0e","text":"Ensure your sample is between 50-150 ng/uL. If it is \u003e 150 ng/uL then it will need dilution. The optimal range for the sample going into size selection is between 100-150ng/uL but protocol will work as long as it's above 50 ng/uL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3rbci","text":"Analyze size selection recoveries via Qubit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3bhf6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1qo92","text":"Note: Quantification post size-selection can be difficult. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"54bjk","text":"Shear at speed 45 for two rounds.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9l0bg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"pch6","text":"Note: From initial testing two cycles compared to one yields a more complete shear, which leads to higher data output when sequenced.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4jlle","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"89fju","text":"Once done, remove item from Megaruptor 3 and carefully remove syringe from tube. Make sure the plunger is fully depressed in order to avoid losing sample. Flushing and Recycling Flow Cells (~15 minutes per set of 4 flow cells)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":2},{"style":"bold","offset":3,"length":71}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ee498","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3on77","text":"Following the completion of the sequencing, flow cells may be removed from the sequencer.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8iasi","text":"Place enough absorbent material to take up approximately 4 mL of flush waste.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"csn7q","text":"Rotate valve to reveal inlet port 1.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ci0b7","text":"Place flow cell at a 45° angle on the absorbent material and, using a P1000, flush 1 mL of DI water into the inlet port.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"egu7h","text":"Repeat 3 more times for a total of 4 mL.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ei66","text":"Once complete, close the inlet port cover and remove all liquid from the waste port.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2t3o5","text":"Dispose of absorbent material as local biological waste guidelines dictate.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cffl9","text":"Return flow cells to clear plastic tray in which it was shipped, making sure to record the flow cell IDs.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1mfh8","text":"Seal the tray with the sticker provided in the packaging.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"86ifj","text":"Put the clear plastic lid back on the tray.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2f25j","text":"Place the tray back in the packaging.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c612r","text":"Place packaged cells in the returns box (large box can hold up to 80).","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4agr3","text":"Once returns box is filled, follow the instructions here and follow the prompts to
